ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: I would not recommend this course because the material was too simple at the start and the instruction was poor.
I would recommend it for people interested in the content, but some aspects were overly technical and less relevant
Good if you do not have any econometrics experience.
This course will be very helpful for those interested in impact evaluations of development programs.

The idea of this course is great and is absolutely needed at Yale. However, its current incarnation does not work. I would not recommend it unless there was a different instructor and revised curriculum.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: The course was a good survey of the techniques behind randomized control trials, but even though I feel like I learned a lot about the process I don't feel like I really learned competently how to do them myself. I am an undergraduate, so it does not contribute to a dissertation, only deeper understanding of my field of international development.
I improved my quantitative and stats skills but would have liked more real life examples and context
